intro: Ottleya mearnsii, commonly known as the Mearns' Ottleya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ottleya mearnsii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
